name: vector_math_64

buildPlaneVectors.name: buildPlaneVectors
buildPlaneVectors.comment: Sets vector_math/vector_math_64.buildPlaneVectors.u and vector_math/vector_math_64.buildPlaneVectors.v to be two vectors orthogonal to each other and vector_math/vector_math_64.buildPlaneVectors.planeNormal.

pickRay.name: pickRay
pickRay.comment:
On success, vector_math/vector_math_64.pickRay.rayNear and vector_math/vector_math_64.pickRay.rayFar are the points where the screen space vector_math/vector_math_64.pickRay.pickX, vector_math/vector_math_64.pickRay.pickY intersect with the near and far planes respectively.

The viewport is specified by (vector_math/vector_math_64.pickRay.viewportX, vector_math/vector_math_64.pickRay.viewportWidth) and (vector_math/vector_math_64.pickRay.viewportY, vector_math/vector_math_64.pickRay.viewportHeight).

vector_math/vector_math_64.pickRay.cameraMatrix includes both the projection and view transforms.

Returns false on error, for example, the mouse is not in the viewport

unproject.name: unproject
unproject.comment:
On success, Sets vector_math/vector_math_64.unproject.pickWorld to be the world space position of the screen space vector_math/vector_math_64.unproject.pickX, vector_math/vector_math_64.unproject.pickY, and vector_math/vector_math_64.unproject.pickZ.

The viewport is specified by (vector_math/vector_math_64.unproject.viewportX, vector_math/vector_math_64.unproject.viewportWidth) and (vector_math/vector_math_64.unproject.viewportY, vector_math/vector_math_64.unproject.viewportHeight).

vector_math/vector_math_64.unproject.cameraMatrix includes both the projection and view transforms.

vector_math/vector_math_64.unproject.pickZ is typically either 0.0 (near plane) or 1.0 (far plane).

Returns false on error, for example, the mouse is not in the viewport

makePlaneReflection.name: makePlaneReflection
makePlaneReflection.comment: Returns a transformation matrix that transforms points by reflecting them through the plane specified with vector_math/vector_math_64.makePlaneReflection.planeNormal and vector_math/vector_math_64.makePlaneReflection.planePoint

makePlaneProjection.name: makePlaneProjection
makePlaneProjection.comment: Returns a transformation matrix that transforms points onto the plane specified with vector_math/vector_math_64.makePlaneProjection.planeNormal and vector_math/vector_math_64.makePlaneProjection.planePoint

makeOrthographicMatrix.name: makeOrthographicMatrix
makeOrthographicMatrix.comment:
Constructs a new OpenGL orthographic projection matrix.

vector_math/vector_math_64.makeOrthographicMatrix.left, vector_math/vector_math_64.makeOrthographicMatrix.right specify the coordinates for the left and right vertical clipping planes. vector_math/vector_math_64.makeOrthographicMatrix.bottom, vector_math/vector_math_64.makeOrthographicMatrix.top specify the coordinates for the bottom and top horizontal clipping planes. vector_math/vector_math_64.makeOrthographicMatrix.near, vector_math/vector_math_64.makeOrthographicMatrix.far specify the coordinates to the near and far depth clipping planes.

setOrthographicMatrix.name: setOrthographicMatrix
setOrthographicMatrix.comment:
Constructs an OpenGL orthographic projection matrix in vector_math/vector_math_64.setOrthographicMatrix.orthographicMatrix.

vector_math/vector_math_64.setOrthographicMatrix.left, vector_math/vector_math_64.setOrthographicMatrix.right specify the coordinates for the left and right vertical clipping planes. vector_math/vector_math_64.setOrthographicMatrix.bottom, vector_math/vector_math_64.setOrthographicMatrix.top specify the coordinates for the bottom and top horizontal clipping planes. vector_math/vector_math_64.setOrthographicMatrix.near, vector_math/vector_math_64.setOrthographicMatrix.far specify the coordinates to the near and far depth clipping planes.

makeFrustumMatrix.name: makeFrustumMatrix
makeFrustumMatrix.comment:
Constructs a new OpenGL perspective projection matrix.

vector_math/vector_math_64.makeFrustumMatrix.left, vector_math/vector_math_64.makeFrustumMatrix.right specify the coordinates for the left and right vertical clipping planes. vector_math/vector_math_64.makeFrustumMatrix.bottom, vector_math/vector_math_64.makeFrustumMatrix.top specify the coordinates for the bottom and top horizontal clipping planes. vector_math/vector_math_64.makeFrustumMatrix.near, vector_math/vector_math_64.makeFrustumMatrix.far specify the coordinates to the near and far depth clipping planes.

setFrustumMatrix.name: setFrustumMatrix
setFrustumMatrix.comment:
Constructs an OpenGL perspective projection matrix in vector_math/vector_math_64.setFrustumMatrix.perspectiveMatrix.

vector_math/vector_math_64.setFrustumMatrix.left, vector_math/vector_math_64.setFrustumMatrix.right specify the coordinates for the left and right vertical clipping planes. vector_math/vector_math_64.setFrustumMatrix.bottom, vector_math/vector_math_64.setFrustumMatrix.top specify the coordinates for the bottom and top horizontal clipping planes. vector_math/vector_math_64.setFrustumMatrix.near, vector_math/vector_math_64.setFrustumMatrix.far specify the coordinates to the near and far depth clipping planes.

makePerspectiveMatrix.name: makePerspectiveMatrix
makePerspectiveMatrix.comment:
Constructs a new OpenGL perspective projection matrix.

vector_math/vector_math_64.makePerspectiveMatrix.fovYRadians specifies the field of view angle, in radians, in the y direction. vector_math/vector_math_64.makePerspectiveMatrix.aspectRatio specifies the aspect ratio that determines the field of view in the x direction. The aspect ratio of x (width) to y (height). vector_math/vector_math_64.makePerspectiveMatrix.zNear specifies the distance from the viewer to the near plane (always positive). vector_math/vector_math_64.makePerspectiveMatrix.zFar specifies the distance from the viewer to the far plane (always positive).

setPerspectiveMatrix.name: setPerspectiveMatrix
setPerspectiveMatrix.comment:
Constructs an OpenGL perspective projection matrix in vector_math/vector_math_64.setPerspectiveMatrix.perspectiveMatrix.

vector_math/vector_math_64.setPerspectiveMatrix.fovYRadians specifies the field of view angle, in radians, in the y direction. vector_math/vector_math_64.setPerspectiveMatrix.aspectRatio specifies the aspect ratio that determines the field of view in the x direction. The aspect ratio of x (width) to y (height). vector_math/vector_math_64.setPerspectiveMatrix.zNear specifies the distance from the viewer to the near plane (always positive). vector_math/vector_math_64.setPerspectiveMatrix.zFar specifies the distance from the viewer to the far plane (always positive).

makeViewMatrix.name: makeViewMatrix
makeViewMatrix.comment:
Constructs a new OpenGL view matrix.

vector_math/vector_math_64.makeViewMatrix.cameraPosition specifies the position of the camera. vector_math/vector_math_64.makeViewMatrix.cameraFocusPosition specifies the position the camera is focused on. vector_math/vector_math_64.makeViewMatrix.upDirection specifies the direction of the up vector (usually, +Y).

setViewMatrix.name: setViewMatrix
setViewMatrix.comment:
Constructs an OpenGL view matrix in vector_math/vector_math_64.setViewMatrix.viewMatrix.

vector_math/vector_math_64.setViewMatrix.cameraPosition specifies the position of the camera. vector_math/vector_math_64.setViewMatrix.cameraFocusPosition specifies the position the camera is focused on. vector_math/vector_math_64.setViewMatrix.upDirection specifies the direction of the up vector (usually, +Y).

absoluteError.name: absoluteError
absoluteError.comment: Returns absolute error between vector_math/vector_math_64.absoluteError.calculated and vector_math/vector_math_64.absoluteError.correct. The type of vector_math/vector_math_64.absoluteError.calculated and vector_math/vector_math_64.absoluteError.correct must match and can be any vector, matrix, or quaternion.

relativeError.name: relativeError
relativeError.comment: Returns relative error between vector_math/vector_math_64.relativeError.calculated and vector_math/vector_math_64.relativeError.correct. The type of vector_math/vector_math_64.relativeError.calculated and vector_math/vector_math_64.relativeError.correct must match and can be any vector, matrix, or quaternion.

class.name: Matrix4
class.preview: 4D Matrix. Values are stored in column major order.

class.name: Matrix3
class.preview: 3D Matrix. Values are stored in column major order.

class.name: Matrix2
class.preview: 2D Matrix. Values are stored in column major order.

class.name: Colors
class.preview: Contains functions for converting between different color models and manipulating colors. In addition to that, some known colors can be accessed for fast prototyping.

packageIntro:
vector_math

!Build Status

Introduction

A Vector math library for 2D and 3D applications.

Features

  • 2D,3D, and 4D vector and matrix types.
  • Quaternion type for animating rotations.
  • Collision detection: AABB, rays, spheres, ...
  • Flexible getters and setters, for example, `position.xwz = color.grb;`.
  • Fully documented.
  • Well tested.
  • Heavily optimized.

Libraries using vector_math

  • Spectre
  • Three.dart
  • Box2D

Getting Started

1\. Add the following to your project's pubspec.yaml and run `pub get`.

dependencies:
  vector_math: any

If you want to stay on the latest developent version, add a dependency to the Git repository. You may also need to use it if another library uses the Git dependency.

dependencies:
  vector_math:
    git: https://github.com/johnmccutchan/vector_math.git

2\. Add the correct import for your project. 

import 'package:vector_math/vector_math.dart';

Documentation

Read the docs

Examples

1\. Using the GLSL getter and setter syntax.

import 'package:vector_math/vector_math.dart';

void main() {
	Vector3 x = new Vector3.zero(); // Zero vector
	Vector4 y = new Vector4.all(4.0); // Vector with 4.0 in all lanes
	x.zyx = y.xzz; // Sets z,y,x the values in x,z,z
}

2\. Transforming a vector.

import 'dart:math';
import 'package:vector_math/vector_math.dart';

void main() {
	// Rotation of PI/2 degrees around the Y axis followed by a 
	// translation of (5.0, 2.0, 3.0).
	Matrix4 T = new Matrix4.rotationY(PI*0.5).translate(5.0, 2.0, 3.0);
	// A point.
	Vector3 position = new Vector3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0);
	// Transform position by T.
	T.transform3(position);
}

3\. Invert a matrix

import 'dart:math';
import 'package:vector_math/vector_math.dart';

void main() {
	// Rotation of 90 degrees around the Y axis followed by a 
	// translation of (5.0, 2.0, 3.0).
	Matrix4 T = new Matrix4.rotationY(PI*0.5).translate(5.0, 2.0, 3.0);
	// Invert T.
	T.invert();
	// Invert just the rotation in T.
	T.invertRotation();
}

4\. Rotate a vector using a quaternion

import 'dart:math';
import 'package:vector_math/vector_math.dart';

void main() {
	// The X axis.
	Vector3 axis = new Vector3(1.0, 0.0, 0.0);
	// 90 degrees.
	double angle = PI/2.0;
	// Quaternion encoding a 90 degree rotation along the X axis. 
	Quaternion q = new Quaternion.axisAngle(axis, angle);
	// A point.
	Vector3 point = new Vector3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0);
	// Rotate point by q.
	q.rotate(point);
}

5\. Check if two axis aligned bounding boxes intersect

import 'package:vector_math/vector_math.dart';

void main() {
	// Define the first box with a minimum and a maximum.
	Aabb2 aabbOne = new Aabb2.minMax(new Vector2.zero(), new Vector2(4.0, 4.0));
	// Define the second box
	Aabb2 aabbTwo = new Aabb2.minMax(new Vector2(5.0, 5.0), new Vector2(6.0, 6.0));
	// Extend the second box to contain a point
	aabbTwo.hullPoint(new Vector2(3.0, 3.0));
	// Check if the two boxes intersect, returns true in this case.
	bool intersect = aabbOne.intersectsWithAabb2(aabbTwo);
}

6\. Check where a ray and a sphere intersect

import 'package:vector_math/vector_math.dart';

void main() {
	// Define a ray starting at the origin and going into positive x-direction.
	Ray ray = new Ray.originDirection(new Vector3.zero(), new Vector3(1.0, 0.0, 0.0));
	// Defines a sphere with the center (5.0 0.0 0.0) and a radius of 2.
	Sphere sphere = new Sphere.centerRadius(new Vector3(5.0, 0.0, 0.0), 2);
	// Checks if the ray intersect with the sphere and returns the distance of the 
	// intersection from the origin of the ray. Would return null if no intersection
	// is found.
	double distancFromOrigin = ray.intersectsWithSphere(sphere);
	// Evaluate the position of the intersection, in this case (3.0 0.0 0.0).
	Vector3 position = ray.at(distancFromOrigin);
}

7\. Work with colors

import 'package:vector_math/vector_math.dart';

void main() {
	// Access a build-in color, colors are stored in 4-dimensional vectors.
	Vector4 red = Colors.red;
	Vector4 gray = new Vector4.zero();
	// Convert the red color to a grayscaled color.
	Colors.toGrayscale(red, gray);
	// Parse a blue color from a hex string.
	Vector4 blue = new Vector4.zero();
	Colors.fromHexString('#0000FF', blue);
	// Convert the blue color from RGB to HSL.
	Colors.rgbToHsl(blue, blue);
	// Reduce the lightness of the color by 50%.
	blue.z *= 0.5;
	// Convert the HSL color back to RGB.
	Colors.hslToRgb(blue, blue);
}
